title: Anthony Timberlands Center
info: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Maecenas a risus quis tortor dictum tempus. Nulla viverra faucibus risus eget dapibus.

title: Lagmansgården School
info: Anttinen Oiva Architects’ competition winning proposal represents a restrained and timeless, high-quality architecture that is organically tied to its place. Our architectural illustrations evoke feelings of the inviting warmth of the indoors in the middle of the magical nordic woods.

title: Nordic Museum Of Photographic Arts Seoul
info: Imagine a building without a definitive shape, that’s whole existence is only created by its interaction with the light, depending on the time of the day. Nordic Arkitekter did exactly that and designed this eye catching museum of photographic art for the Korean capital.

title: European Medicines Agency
client: BIG in cooperation with Coldefy & Associés Architectes Urbaniste
info: In the very heart of this campus project in Lille, France stands a soothing garden and the whole concept was built around this green oasis. We choose to show this environmentally conscious building with an emphasis on its closeness to nature.

title: Anonymous Hotel Project
info: Architectural visualization has the power to show a building without using overly dramatic tools. Sometimes subtlety and a light-hearted approach are what a design and the building’s future use requires, as in this case. The romantic image was created for the Hungarian studio, Singer.

title: 550 West Randolph
info: Built in 1909, Gensler kept this building’s original timber post and beam craftsmanship, adding high-tech amenities to comply with the modern needs of an office space in the center of Chicago. Our visualization was based on an old photograph of the buzzing streets from the first decade of the 1900’s.

title: Shanghai Grand Opera House
info: Snøhetta won the international competition to develop Shanghai’s new opera building, it’s landscape, interior, and graphic design. We illustrated their design in an evocative way to show the highly sophisticated concept behind our client’s grand project.

title: Trigoni, Helsinki High-Rise
info: The name reflects the triangular shapes of the skyscrapers in Helsinki’s new city center, designed by Lahdelma & Mahlamäki architects. As a complex project, we created numerous architectural visualizations, angles and views, but we believe that this one captures the essence of these megaprojects.

title: The Beacon
info: White Arkitekter’s concept building, made from carbon-neutral timber, activates the surrounding streets and a newly accessible waterfront as a public destination. Our birdview visualization shows the stunning neighborhood with the lively seaside.

title: Dresden Residential
info: Architectural visualizations of residential buildings have to sensitively show the future life of the neighborhood and the environment to capture the imagination of future residents. The little details and moods are key factors in creating powerful marketing tools for our clients.

title: Novosibirsk Study
info: In the middle of a dense forest, in a national park, next to the River Ob, KZA’s study showcases a humble design for the city of Novosibirsk in Northern Russia. The location and the trees have inspired us and if you watch carefully, you can explore the fauna of the region beside the flora.

title: Flekkerøy Church
info: Dark and heavy nordic skies give contrast to the white, almost glowing church building on this architectural visualization we have created for Link Arkitektur. Their competition proposal was designed for the city of Kristiansand in the south of Norway.

title: Lacadiere Center
info: This high-profile interior is located in one of the 3 skyscrapers of Chengdu’s Lacardier Center, all of them designed by SCDA Architects. The centered composition highlights the contrast of the luxurious surfaces, gaining attention from the viewer.

title: Trigoni, Helsinki High-Rise
info: The name reflects the triangular shapes of the skyscrapers in Helsinki’s new city center, designed by Lahdelma & Mahlamäki architects. As a complex project, we created numerous architectural visualizations, angles and views, but we believe that this one captures the essence of these megaprojects.

title: The Yellow Pubmarine
info: We have created a super cool bar interior for ourselves. We had so much fun visualizing an underwater joint with colleagues as cutout people, inspired and challenged by the unusual lighting of the imagined scenario.

title: Museum of Hungarian Architecture
info: This black and white interior was created for a local project. We love how the angle and the lines lead the viewer’s gaze and let them get immersed in the image. This visualization illustrates the future life inside the competition winner museum building, dedicated to the best of Hungarian architecture.

title: Lagmansgården School
info: We choose to visualize not only the dark, nordic winter but the summer fun of the North on  Oiva Architects’ competition winning school projects. With the help of a touch of storytelling, you can “walk around” in the project and discover the wonderful relationship between the building and its amazing surroundings.

title: Itt lesz egy Zaha Video
info: When something is as characteristic as the stairway of this hotel, a minimal, yet bold approach to illustrate the yet to be built future is a great way to create a memorable image that stands out. Gensler’s hotel design for the citizenM group will be built in sunny Menlo Park, California.
